item.title: Two Point Museum x Revenge of the Savage Planet collaboration update now available
item.content:encoded:
The newest rift to appear in the Digiverse.

Publisher SEGA and developer Two Point Studios have released a free update for Two Point Museum that brings Raccoon Logic Studios’ Revenge of the Savage Planet to the museum, the companies announced.

Here is an overview of the update, via SEGA:

Curators can expect vibrant extraterrestrial flora, environmental oddities, and creatures that may or may not obey the laws of physics—or common sense. It’s a chaotic crossover that blends the frantic havoc of Raccoon Logic Studios’ Revenge of the Savage Planet with the delightfully disastrous management mayhem fans know and fear.

Available now on PC, Xbox Series, PlayStation 5, and Switch 2, this latest update brings a new rift to Two Point Museum, launching the game into the furthest reaches of the Digiverse, where alien oddities, bizarre biology, and nonsensical science collide.

Curators are now officially encouraged (not legally required) to curate the galaxy. Following the discovery of a mysterious rift, brave curators will hop from planet to planet exploring three distinct Points of Interest and recover exhibits from the strange and savage world of Revenge of the Savage Planet. Along the way, curators will wrangle temperamental life forms and bitey flora such as Arid Maw and Fungal Maw and delight visitors with exhibits that are as colourful as they are unpredictably mischievous. Survival-lite expeditions, unexpected experiments, and scientifically questionable discoveries await every curator!

  • ❮
  • ❯

There are six brand-new exhibits to recover, plus new Staff Room additions focused on “team bonding” rather than safety. Curators can install a High-Five Machine and a staff-sized Hamster Wheel, then dress staff for interstellar duty in a brand-new outfit—helmets optional, common sense unavailable.

Key Features

  • Experts can explore the world of Revenge of the Savage Planet, visiting Stellaris Prime, Xephyr, and the Zenithian Rift.
  • Collect six new exhibits, including Botany Exhibits as well as new Terrarium and Habitat creatures.
  • Create a real sci-fi feel with new decorative items and a new vending machine.
  • Get ready for interstellar travel with a new Staff Outfit and Staff Room items.
  • Discover a brand-new set of Materials for creating items in the Workshop.

With cosmic chaos, environmental oddities, and classic Two Point mischief, Revenge of the Savage Planet proves once again that museum management is challenging, adventurous, and deeply unwise—especially when alien biology meets corporate ambition.

Not only that, but for the first time ever, players can also discover Two Point Museum goodies in another universe, exploring Pointian exhibits in Revenge of the Savage Planet.

Two Point Museum is available now for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, Switch 2, and PC via Steam.

Watch a new trailer below. View a new set of screenshots at the gallery.

Revenge of the Savage Planet Collaboration Update Trailer

item.title: PowerWash Simulator 2 DLC ‘Adventure Time Pack’ announced
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • PS5
  • Switch 2
  • Xbox Series

Due out in spring 2026.

FuturLab has announced PowerWash Simulator 2 downloadable content “Adventure Time Pack.” It will launch in spring 2026 for $7.99 / £6.50 / €7.99.

“We’re so excited to take players on a totally mathematical cleaning adventure in our very first pack for PowerWash Simulator 2, in collaboration with the folks at Warner Bros. Interactive Entertainment and Cartoon Network,” said FuturLab CEO Kirsty Rigden in a press release. “With so many of our talented team being huge fans of the show, we’ve crammed this bright, bold pack with love and references to the beloved show.”

Here is an overview of the downloadable content, via its Steam page:

About

Officially licensed by Warner Bros. Interactive Entertainment, the pack features five fan-favorite Adventure Time locations to wash and explore, brand new custom equipment, and a brilliantly bananas storyline with Princess Bubblegum, Finn, Jake, The Ice King, Gunter, and The Party God! Each job is packed with grime and Adventure Time Easter eggs for fans to discover as they blast away the dirt!

Key Features

  • Clean Up Distant Lands – Who wants to play video games?! Clean up five new levels from the Land of Ooo. Don’t worry, everything stays right where you left it, but just a little bit cleaner.
  • Grab Your Friends or Adventure Solo – Homies help homies, always. So, brave the filth solo, grab your BFF to clean through the campaign together, or grab your four-man band to shred schmutz in free-play.

PowerWash Simulator 2 is available now for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, Switch 2, and PC via Steam, Epic Games Store, and Microsoft Store.

Watch the announcement trailer below.

DLC “Adventure Time Pack” Announce Trailer



https://www.gematsu.com/2025/12/powerwash-simulator-2-dlc-adventure-time-pack-announced
